main.name: Aditya Shah
main.bio: A movie geek at heart, always browsing to sate my appetite for good content, a knack for software development and a passion for data. Currently finished my undergraduate degree and working as a software engineer. Have developed interest in Big Data and Information Systems
main.contactmessage: Right now the contact is not service integrated. Please use mail or other medium

education.school: Birla Institute of Technology and Sciences, Pilani
education.degree: M.Sc. Mathematics and B.E. Computer Science
education.description: Innovation in Science Pursuit for Inspired Research (INSPIRE) Scholar by Department of Science and Technology, Government of India
Dhirubhai Ambani SSC Merit Award Scholar

work.title: Member of Technical Staff
work.description: Working on transactional capabilities in Hive considering multi-engines like Spark and Presto support.

work.title: Intern
work.description: Working in the Hive Team. Hive is a data warehouse infrastructure tool to process structured data in Hadoop. Key assignments were, building a new feature of Eventual Consistency check, Improving the initial mapper estimation in Tez execution engine considering Auto-Scaling and Hive Transactions.

work.title: Summer Intern
work.description: Evaluated some of the open-source libraries for mobile-specific UI components based on React and Integrated them in the DESCO JavaScript Stack. Setup two full-stack app for InOut (leave management portal) and DESFlow (Request Tracker) mobile revamped version show casing the new UI components.

guidedWork.company: Web Intelligence and Social Computing Lab, BITS Pilani
guidedWork.title: Research Assistant
guidedWork.guide: Prof. Yashvardhan Sharma, Associate professor, Dept. of Computer Science, BITS Pilani.
guidedWork.description: Worked under on Event Extraction from code mixed data (Hindi, Malayalam, and Tamil) of social media text.

guidedWork.title: Surge Research Intern
guidedWork.guide: Prof. Deepak Gupta, Professor, Materials Science and Engineering, IIT Kanpur.
guidedWork.description: Worked to develop a Cost-Effective Anti-counterfeiting technology. My project involved identifying 3D textures, authenticating images and generating signatures of images for indexing and searching. This was a part of the larger project to commercialize a patented lab implementation to tackle counterfeiting problem for any product that is being sold anywhere, with the plan to move it out of the IITK lab in the form of an independent startup entity.

guidedWork.company: Bhaskaracharya Institute for Space Applications and Geo-Informatics, Gandhi Nagar
guidedWork.title: Summer Intern
guidedWork.guide: DigVijay Singh Chauhan, Project Scientist, BISAG.
guidedWork.description: Worked on Vehicle Detection to analyze traffic flow within the campus. Developed a system in which given a video, vehicles are detected in each frame using SVM and Haar Cascade Algorithm. The system ran on Distributed File System for large-scale data processing using Dumbo API.

projects.title: Network In Network
projects.description: Implemented Networks in networks by Min Lin, Qiang Chen, Shuicheng Yan as a part of course project.

projects.title: Adversarial Neural Cryptography
projects.description: Implemented Learning to Protect Communications with Adversarial Neural Cryptography by Martín Abadi, David G. Andersen as a part of the course project

projects.title: Other Projects
projects.description: Created a Compiler in C for a dummy language as part of Compiler Construction Course, Implemented DBSCAN using functional programming language Scheme, Wave Generator in Assembly, Algebraic expression simplifier and college constitution in Prolog

guidedProjects.title: Forecasting Renewable Energy Resources
guidedProjects.guide: Prof. Sumanta Pasari, Assistant professor, Dept. of Mathematics, BITS Pilani
guidedProjects.description: Forecasting Wind speed, temperature and Pressure from data obtained from Charanka Power Plant, Gujarat Using ARIMA models and Recurrent Neural Networks with LSTM.

guidedProjects.title: Biometric Iris Recognition for Low Quality Distance Iris Images
guidedProjects.guide: Prof. Kamlesh Tiwari, Assistant professor, Dept. of Computer Science, BITS Pilani.
guidedProjects.description: Used Haar Cascade Classifiers and Histogram of Oriented Gradients (HOG) for eye segmentation followed by thresholding and occlusion removal then using Gabor filters and Hamming Distance for normalization and matching.

guidedProjects.title: Advanced Scheduling Algorithms
guidedProjects.guide: Prof. Rakhee, Associate professor, Dept. of Mathematics, BITS Pilani.
guidedProjects.description: Developed a library of scheduling algorithms (operation research) covering single machine, parallel machine and shop scheduling in python

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Aditya Shah must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
